author: iplante
title: Clever little model!
review:
When I first saw this set, I thought that the main model was kind of ugly. I decided to purchase it anyway, because I love Creator 3-in-1 sets. I'm impressed! I have only built the main model os far, so this review will only cover the box, instructions, and main model.

Edit: I've edited the review to add information on the second (quad) and third (forklift) models.

Box/Instructions

Regular cardboard box with a "punch-hole" opening, with three instructions booklet - one for each model.

Parts

There's one part I had never seen before - the 1x4 plate with 'teeth' on it. Otherwise, the light blue parts aren't as common as far as I know.

Minifigures

N/A

The build

The build was simple and fun, as is to be expected for 106 pieces. However, there are pretty clever building techniques here, for the seat backrest, headrest, and steering wheel / front wheel mechanism. The second build uses 1x2 plates with raised hinges for handlebars, which I hadn't seen before. The build was really simple, but I liked the model. The third build (forklift) has rear wheels that move so you can sort of steer the vehicle as well.

The completed model

The model is so cool! Not only can you move the seat, but you can steer thanks to the cog attached to the steering wheel mechanism moving the previously mentioned 1x4 groove plate. I've never seen a set this simple give us the ability to steer, it was a pleasant surprise!

The second model, the quad, was super simple. I thought it was going to be disappointing but it turned out to be a sturdy little vehicle that is fun to play with.

The third model is a forklift. I had high expectations for it, but the forks don't move up and down as I would've liked. You can 'steer' with the back wheels, which kinda gives it a weird unstable feel. The forks also drag when you move the lift around.

Overall opinion

I'll build the two other models over the next few days - and perhaps update this review to reflect my opinion of those as well. So far, however, I'm pleased with the set, even though the price per piece seems pretty steep at almost 9.5 cents a piece. 

Edit: I liked the second model a lot too, but the third model was a bit disappointing. I don't expect all three builds of a 3-in-1 to be amazing, however, so I'm still pleased with this set.
